intro: Micromeles khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi apple, is a small evergreen tree native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its elliptical leaves that are dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by edible, apple-like fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and traditional medicine.
